section.title: Configure RabbitMQ
section.para: Here we are building a cluster of RabbitMQ nodes to construct a RabbitMQ broker. Mirrored queues in RabbitMQ improve the availability of service since it will be resilient to failures. We have to consider that while exchanges and bindings will survive the loss of individual nodes, queues and their messages will not because a queue and its contents is located on one node. If we lose this node, we also lose the queue.

We consider that we run (at least) two RabbitMQ servers. To build a broker, we need to ensure that all nodes have the same erlang cookie file. To do so, stop RabbitMQ everywhere and copy the cookie from rabbit1 server to other server(s):
